intro: Hetaeria heterosepala, commonly known as the broad-leaved hetaeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are fibrous and can spread laterally, allowing it to establish itself in various soil types. Hetaeria heterosepala is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
